tweets.text: My latest #PhD paper is now out! Assessing studded tiles as a tool for re-establishing river connectivity for river lamprey, and suggestions for future tile designs. Check out the #openaccess paper: https://t.co/PDToq91B2i #fishsci #lampetra @DurUni_Aqua_Lab @DurBiol @EnvAgency https://t.co/RVqEocUXXZ

Hi @DaveThroupEA and @EnvAgency . Can this not go to ALL farmers and landowners in ALL catchments? I would have thought that recent news re river quality across the country would indicate that this is necessary everywhere. https://t.co/H5mWaa0NKq

Our beautiful rivers are in crisis. Recent @EnvAgency data showed none of England's rivers are in good overall health üò®
We're grateful to all our volunteers who dedicate time to helping our rivers, but we need more govt. regulation to combat this crisis #WorldRiversDay üëä https://t.co/6MZ0vxjiXq

Our fisheries enforcement officers were out patrolling the #Midlands waterways this weekend making sure all anglers had an up-to-date #fishing licence. 

If you don't have a licence to #fish you could land more than you bargained for! 

Get yours: https://t.co/FTjr2HV0XC https://t.co/p7FpoYBewV

@EnvAgencyMids There's a very good candidate for this in Rugby. South Sow Brook currently in a culvert for 1/4 mile surrounded by public open space. Then runs another mile in the open mostly P.O.S. around it.

tweets.text:
Don't believe all you read on #chalkstreams

We won a @The_RRC award in #Hampshire ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/MgDgLleDd8

...and in #Hertfordshire, our warning to @thameswater changed its operation. The #RiverChess was on Radio 4's #WATO: https://t.co/a3LKrWeCDQ, from 35:59 #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/IMrgCEA5gh
@ConorMcG1one @EnvAgency https://t.co/cYHCmPKWvj

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.

@leeinthelakes @WildHaweswater @OpenSpaceGB @lakedistrictnpa @EnvAgencyNW @NECumbria @Natures_Voice @unitedutilities @WildLakeland @herdyshepherd1 @UllswaterCic And from 1st photo you can already see that the re-wiggling's going to get wilder. Think you'll have to tell O.S. it's time to revise their map.
Sometimes the words of a child makes the most sense.  Wise words for someone so young #environment #recycling #litterpick @lowcarbonlich @EnvAgency @LegendsLitter https://t.co/DZ5ZcWfoQK

Just did my bit for @FreshWaterWatch testing water samples at #Radcot for levels of nitrates and sulphates on the #Thames - quite high levels due to run off, though I would love to find out more. @Earthwatch_Eur @ThamesPathNT @thameswater @EnvAgency @WCL_News @WhiteHorseDC https://t.co/JG9YPScI20

For @Feargal_Sharkey , no surprises here? Nitrate and Phosphate levels in Rivers Ver and Colne show river conditions as moderate or poor... not the ‚Äògood‚Äô the @EnvAgency predicted from 2015. Oh well... #chalkstream https://t.co/XtWGJusulB
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency Any exchanges available? Moving the goal posts just enables the private water companies to avoid their responsibilities.

#srilanka returns containers of #illegal #waste to #Britain @GOVUK

@ConorMcG1one @EnvAgency And then 'we' wonder why the usual export markets are gradually being lost.....

Tomorrow, 29 September at 5pm BST, JOIN US for a virtual panel discussion on The Future of the Countryside. With @van_griffiths @EnvAgency, @Minette_Batters @NFUtweets, Mark Bridgeman @CLAtweets, @CrispinTruman @CPRE, and Becky Speight @Natures_Voice. https://t.co/Gr180uODZs

The @EnvAgency has also failed on waste incineration - handing out permits like sweets for incinerators, such as the 660,000 tonnes per year Rivenhall incinerator in rural north Essex to pump out toxic CO2 from the UK‚Äôs shortest smoke stack at 35 metres. https://t.co/K9BEX4rqj8
Not this again. More inspections/greater investment in @EnvAgency needed. https://t.co/6OXW5w7rVS

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

tweets.text:
Thread 1/4

Letter currently being sent to 1200 farmers and land managers in the Lugg catchment #herefordshire reminding them of their legal responsibilities and asking for their help in reducing phosphate levels in local rivers. https://t.co/ECPTsMpy8O

The Sri Lankan government says it is sending 21 shipping containers of waste back to the UK after customs officials found they contained hazardous material, in breach of international laws.
https://t.co/26P9ucjkdL
#wastecrime

If you are paying someone to take your waste away, it is classed as business waste and businesses should pay to dispose of their waste. #tiprun #blackbags #gardenclearance #SCRAPflytipping 
@EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/EFIvmvjTw0

That moment when the water starts to flow in your newly-created, meandering river channel!  üåä üéâ Phase 1 of our river restoration project at Thrimby Grange in partnership with the landowner and @EnvAgencyNW, with support from @networkrail . Design @AquaUoS #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/kw1LPtj5vL

tweets.text: @greenarteries @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @cllrkatie @camcitco Hi Wendy, sorry you've lost me a little? The report for the whole of the UK came out a few weeks ago so perhaps after this briefing? Everything I referenced is linked to in the copy. No blame is put on EA, and 'bathing quality' isn't mentioned either.

@Feargal_Sharkey @freddie_lynne were you at recent  @EnvAgencyAnglia briefing? No mention of report. May have missed. But Rob Bakewell (EA)did say @EnvAgency not responsible for river bathing quality. Exec cllr @cllrkatie  @camcitco is running ‚Äúwater awareness‚Äù next year with EA & local partners.

To celebrate #WorldRiversDay #TeamEA are highlighting our work in partnership with @EdenRiversTrust & @networkrail in Thrimby An 800m channel realignment project that will not only provide benefits to fish and other wildlife but also reduce flood risk to the West Coast Main Line. https://t.co/FwwebMtf9o

A very special visit last week from Marcus @MumfordAndSons to the #LakeDistrict river restoration projects delivered by @ullswatercic in partnership with @EnvAgency and @herdyshepherd. 

Our rivers are no longer a #HoplessWanderer ‚Ä¶ #IWillWait for a better pun. https://t.co/SpTSapbOsd

Plant trees, pick litter. Vote/ write to MP to push funding for regulation. Engage networks. Buy @SoilAssociation @mcsuk certified.

tweets.text: @AndyLeeGeo @EnvAgency @LivingAtlas @dataenvagency Hi Andy, currently there is no release schedule, although we strive to keep the Living Atlas updated on a regular basis. For future layers we will consider layer types which improve the ease of mapping and analysis in ArcGIS Online.
LLL aka Lichfield Litter Legends collect 56 bags of rubbish at their Great British September Clean @KeepBritainTidy @stwater @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWestMidlands @LegendsLitter https://t.co/5iixuBtIj9

* No English river met @EnvAgency quality tests for pollution
* Only 14% are of "good ecological standard"
* 200,000 sewage discharges per yr
"A culture is no better than its rivers." (WH Auden, adapted)
Water companies & EA cuts are leading to disaster.
https://t.co/BuihH2ZNHN

We've reviewed the full period-of-record at over 140 sites in order to improve our national Peak Flow Dataset - that's nearly 6,000 years of data! https://t.co/0bpMwvmT7d @EnvAgency @NatResWales @ScottishEPA @deptinfra https://t.co/VL00gl5rS9

I've asked to interview @JamesBevanEA @EmmaEHoward George Eustice @pow_rebecca etc about this (among other things) but @DefraGovUK  @EnvAgency press office told me they were unavailable, which is odd, because I didn't specify a time or date. 
https://t.co/2tFq4IdSr2

tweets.text:
Another day, another beach sampleüèñÔ∏è

An officer has been sampling the water at Frinton-on-Sea in Essex. This will be one of the last samples taken as bathing water season is coming to an end.  #Beach #Essex https://t.co/3wmcvSW5Q7

We are coming towards the end of the bathing water season. 

Samplers test bathing waters from May to September to check the water quality as well as other things.

Here is West Runton in Norfolk which is rated as excellentüòÉ #beach #norfolk https://t.co/hcNXfPiFoy

Great to see so many #flood wardens & #community #volunteers on our Incident Management webinar tonight - we‚Äôre talking plans & procedures for groups, command structure, managing the media, flood plans & much more! #CPYorks @EnvAgencyYNE @SimonHildonEA @GroundworkYorks https://t.co/sYvYNuOcEK
@EnvAgency Your responsible for our waterways and you are failing. There has been no improvement in years and you are letting raw sewage be dumped in our rivers. https://t.co/RPuayKUR5X

‚ÄúPledge for nature‚Äù funded by net gain offsetting ie develop. No mention of water infrastructure first? Yet South East requires 50% future nat water supply (Summary, @EnvAgency Nat Framework) No invite @Feargal_Sharkey? see @HugoSAS https://t.co/gDnyzZKK6u https://t.co/KCzWuUEFvY
Some very, very good news. This is brilliant. https://t.co/OiIdwnIAty
